header.name: access-control-allow-credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.name: access-control-allow-origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: access-control-expose-headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.name: cache-control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: content-length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: content-type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: etag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: status
header.description: Custom header

header.name: strict-transport-security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: x-content-type-options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: x-frame-options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: x-xss-protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

header.name: access-control-allow-credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.name: access-control-allow-origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: access-control-expose-headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.name: cache-control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: content-length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: content-type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: etag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: status
header.description: Custom header

header.name: strict-transport-security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: x-content-type-options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: x-frame-options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: x-xss-protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

header.name: access-control-allow-credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.name: access-control-allow-origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: access-control-expose-headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

response.body:
{"message":{"text":"1. Scandinave Getaway
Enjoy massage treatments situated in a serene natural forest with an on-site bistro serving healthy local fare
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat

2. Brewery Tour
Explore Boston's thriving brewpub scene and taste roughly 18 types of beer on these guided morning and evening brewery tours.
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat
Check availability: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat

3. Whale Watching
Experience the marine wildlife on this guided, 3-hour whale-watching cruise around the National Marine Sanctuary.
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat
Check availability: https://ticketing.bostonharborcruises.com/WebStore/shop/ViewItems.aspx?CG=EXCR&C=WW

4. French Dining
Gary Danko provides an award-winning combination of classic French cooking and personable yet impeccable service.
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat
Check availability: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat

5. Seafood Cuisine
Ostra focuses on specialty seafood and the cuisine highlights the natural and fresh flavors of each dish.
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat

{"message":{"text":"1. Scandinave Getaway
Enjoy massage treatments situated in a serene natural forest with an on-site bistro serving healthy local fare
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat

2. Brewery Tour
Explore Boston's thriving brewpub scene and taste roughly 18 types of beer on these guided morning and evening brewery tours.
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat
Check availability: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat

3. Whale Watching
Experience the marine wildlife on this guided, 3-hour whale-watching cruise around the National Marine Sanctuary.
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat
Check availability: https://ticketing.bostonharborcruises.com/WebStore/shop/ViewItems.aspx?CG=EXCR&C=WW

4. French Dining
Gary Danko provides an award-winning combination of classic French cooking and personable yet impeccable service.
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat
Check availability: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat

5. Seafood Cuisine
Ostra focuses on specialty seafood and the cuisine highlights the natural and fresh flavors of each dish.

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Poll-Interval
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

query.description: For now the only acceptable value is code.
You may pass in any arbitrary string value here which will be returned to you along with the code via browser redirect.

You may pass in a redirect_uri to determine which URI the response is redirected to. This URI must be contained in the list configured by your integration. If this option is not passed, the first URI present in the list will be used.

{"message":{"text":"1. Scandinave Getaway
Enjoy massage treatments situated in a serene natural forest with an on-site bistro serving healthy local fare.


2. Brewery Tour
Explore Boston's thriving brewpub scene and taste roughly 18 types of beer on these guided morning and evening brewery tours.


3. Whale Watching
Experience the marine wildlife on this guided, 3-hour whale-watching cruise around the National Marine Sanctuary.


4. French Dining
Gary Danko provides an award-winning combination of classic French cooking and personable yet impeccable service.


5. Seafood Cuisine
Ostra focuses on specialty seafood and the cuisine highlights the natural and fresh flavors of each dish.

item.name: WhatsApp Message Templates

query.description: When specified, returns all the translations for a single message template.
When specified, limits the number of message templates to return per page.
When specified, returns the message templates on the previous page. (eg: MjUZD)
When specified, returns the message templates on the next page. (eg: NDkZD)

request.description: Lists all WhatsApp message templates in the account
Creates a new WhatsApp message template.
Deletes a message template.

item.description: List, create, and delete endpoints. These endpoints call the WaBiz endpoints so make sure your WhatsApp integration has businessManagerId in its data. If it does not, you can make a PUT request to your integration, supplying businessManagerId, accountId, and phoneNumberId. To obtain phoneNumberId, follow this guide: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dzW-YRgpWWS8m83iIWG5bHtyrB-fzqpLpyiKOi_HGBM
